originalText.text:
Was here on Thursday very briefly. Walking up, there wasn‚Äôt a line. I was immediately greeted with a smile.

I‚Äôm not a huge coffee drinker (I stick to what I know), but the woman there made everything easy.

I ended up getting an iced vanilla latte with oat/macadamia nut milk.

It was really delicious! It wasn‚Äôt too sweet and the coffee wasn‚Äôt too strong!

I would recommend coming back here for a cup of coffee!

originalText.text:
I was standing ready to order where it says ‚Äúorder here‚Äù when a group of people arrived and  ordered from where you should pick up drinks. so i went behind them at the pick-up area and then they were asked to go to the register where i was initially. When they moved, I told the lady in the pick up area my order and she told me to go to the register to order. üôà
Maybe they need a better ordering system.

The croissant was good. The coffee was ok.

originalText.text: It‚Äôs right next to the little island so you can go take a walk with their delicious coffee! They have normal coffee and their signature coffee and I really like their signature coffee. It‚Äôs so savory and tasty. They have seats in the same building so if you‚Äôre not a hot weather fan, you can sit inside. I really recommend their coffee! They also sell their coffee beans and goods. ‚ù§Ô∏è

originalText.text: Had an excellent specialty latte here! I got the blackbird latte which had a housemade almond macadamia nut milk in it. The flavor combo was excellent.  It had blackberries and thyme. They have a selection of other lattes as well. This coffeeshop is located inside a food hall and there was plenty of seating when I went plus even rooftop area so it's an excellent spot to go to with friends.  I didn't try any of their pastries but they offered some unique pastries including a matcha bar, black sesame bar, pandan mochi and more.

text.text: Had an excellent specialty latte here! I got the blackbird latte which had a housemade almond macadamia nut milk in it. The flavor combo was excellent.  It had blackberries and thyme. They have a selection of other lattes as well. This coffeeshop is located inside a food hall and there was plenty of seating when I went plus even rooftop area so it's an excellent spot to go to with friends.  I didn't try any of their pastries but they offered some unique pastries including a matcha bar, black sesame bar, pandan mochi and more.

originalText.text: Staff was friendly but seemed disorganized. Ordered a decaf Mockingbird latte and matcha latte. Person taking the order originally told me that she wasn't sure if there was decaf available, so she talked to someone else, who talked to the barista and the barista wasn't sure, so I was told at the counter that there wasn't decaf - only to be told by the barista as I was about to pay that she had found the bag of decaf beans and was able to make my drink decaf. When I was given my drinks, I walked off and realized that the matcha latte was cold. When I walked back to the counter and complained, the barista ended up sticking the steamer nozzle in the espresso machine straight into the cup, without asking whether someone drank out of the cup already, which seems like a potential health hazard (not sanitary). Based on my visit, I think the staff needs more training and would not recommend.
